unnormalised: EdTech Startup Aims to Bridge Scholarship Gap with New Portal
normalised: EdTech Startup Aims to Bridge Scholarship Gap with New Portal

unnormalised: Mumbai, Oct 26 – A new scholarship portal, “Vidyadhan Bharat,” launched this week, seeks to connect deserving students with available funding opportunities across India. The platform, developed by local EdTech startup, EduLeap Solutions, aims to streamline the often-cumbersome scholarship application process.
normalised: Mumbai, October twenty six – A new scholarship portal, “Vidyadhan Bharat,” launched this week, seeks to connect deserving students with available funding opportunities across India. The platform, developed by local EdTech startup, EduLeap Solutions, aims to streamline the often-cumbersome scholarship application process.

unnormalised: “Many brilliant students, especially in rural areas, miss out on scholarships due to lack of awareness or complex application procedures,” said Priya Sharma, CEO of EduLeap. “Vidyadhan Bharat simplifies everything, offering a centralized database and application support.”
normalised: “Many brilliant students, especially in rural areas, miss out on scholarships due to lack of awareness or complex application procedures,” said Priya Sharma, C E O of EduLeap. “Vidyadhan Bharat simplifies everything, offering a centralized database and application support.”

unnormalised: The platform currently lists scholarships worth over Rs. 5 Crore, targeting students from Class 10 onwards pursuing various disciplines, including engineering, medicine, and vocational training. A special section caters to students from economically weaker sections, highlighting scholarships like the “Kalpana Chawla Scholarship” for aspiring astronauts.
normalised: The platform currently lists scholarships worth over rupee five crore, targeting students from Class ten onwards pursuing various disciplines, including engineering, medicine, and vocational training. A special section caters to students from economically weaker sections, highlighting scholarships like the “Kalpana Chawla Scholarship” for aspiring astronauts.

unnormalised: The launch coincides with the festive season, and EduLeap announced a special "Onam Scholarship Drive" offering mentorship and financial aid for students preparing for competitive exams. This drive includes a biryani-making competition, where scholarship recipients can showcase their culinary skills and win additional prizes. The portal has already garnered attention from institutions like IIT Bombay and Delhi University, with partnerships expected to be announced soon.
